intro: Secamone gracilis, commonly known as slender secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically fragrant. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds.
